Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • Employee
  • public class Employee
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static boolean autoAddData
      If true, data is automatically set for Employee objects, if false, user must manually enter data
      private java.lang.String department
      Employee Department
      private static java.lang.String fileName
      Employee database file name
      private int idNumber
      Employee ID Number
      static java.util.Scanner input
      Create new Scanner object for user input, used in the following methods: setInput() inputData() confirmData() getFileName() openFile() readFile()
      private java.lang.String name
      Employee Name
      private java.lang.String position
      Employee Position

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Employee()
      Creates new Employee object, name, department, and position assigned as empty strings, idNumber field assigned as 0
      Employee​(java.lang.String name, int idNum)
      Creates new Employee object, sets name and idNumber data fields, department and position fields assigned as empty strings
      Employee​(java.lang.String name, int idNum, java.lang.String dept, java.lang.String pos)
      Creates new Employee object and sets all data fields

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static boolean confirmData​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
      The confirmData method takes an ArrayList of Employee objects and displays the objects attributes, then it prompts the user to confirm writing the data to the file.

      Gets employee department
      private static java.lang.String getFile()
      Returns fileName value

      Gets employee ID Number

      Gets employee name
      java.lang.String getPosition()
      Gets employee position

      The inputData method prompts the user to enter the employee data manually, then creates a new Employee object and adds it to the ArrayList of Employee objects
      static void openFile()
      The openFile method calls the getFile method, creates a new file object by calling getFile method to return file name.
      static void readFile()
      The readFile method prompts the user to verify the data written to the file, if yes, the data is read as input and displayed to the screen

      private void setPosition​(java.lang.String pos)
      Sets employee position
      static void writeToFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
      The writeToFile method loops through the ArrayList of Employee objects and writes their attributes to the file formatted as a table

    • Field Detail

      • input

        public static final java.util.Scanner input
        Create new Scanner object for user input, used in the following methods: setInput() inputData() confirmData() getFileName() openFile() readFile()

      • autoAddData

        private static boolean autoAddData
        If true, data is automatically set for Employee objects, if false, user must manually enter data

        Employee database file name

      • Employee

        Employee​(java.lang.String name,
         int idNum,
         java.lang.String dept,
         java.lang.String pos)
        Creates new Employee object and sets all data fields
        Parameters:
        name - Employee Name
        idNum - Employee ID Number
        dept - Employee Department
        pos - Employee Position

      • Employee

        Employee​(java.lang.String name,
         int idNum)
        Creates new Employee object, sets name and idNumber data fields, department and position fields assigned as empty strings
        Parameters:
        name - Employee Name
        idNum - Employee ID Number

      • Employee

        Employee()
        Creates new Employee object, name, department, and position assigned as empty strings, idNumber field assigned as 0

    • Method Detail

      • setInput

        public static void setInput()
        The setInput method prompts the user to either have the data entered automatically or have them enter it in manually, if user selects manually, autoAddData is set to false

      • getInput

        public static boolean getInput()
        Returns true if data is automatically added, false if user is manually entering data
        Returns:
        Boolean value for autoAddData

      • inputData

        public static void inputData​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
        The inputData method prompts the user to enter the employee data manually, then creates a new Employee object and adds it to the ArrayList of Employee objects
        Parameters:
        employees - ArrayList of Employee objects

      • confirmData

        public static boolean confirmData​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
        The confirmData method takes an ArrayList of Employee objects and displays the objects attributes, then it prompts the user to confirm writing the data to the file. If the data is to be written, the method returns true.
        Parameters:
        employees - ArrayList of Employee objects
        Returns:
        Boolean value, true if data is confirmed

      • getFileName

        public static void getFileName()
        The getFileName method prompts the user to enter a file name, then calls the setFile method to assign the value to the fileName variable

      • setFile

        private static void setFile​(java.lang.String file)
        Sets the fileName variable
        Parameters:
        file - String value of file name

      • getFile

        private static java.lang.String getFile()
        Returns fileName value
        Returns:
        String of file name

      • openFile

        public static void openFile()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        The openFile method calls the getFile method, creates a new file object by calling getFile method to return file name. If the file already exists the method asks if the file should be overwritten, if yes, the file is overwritten, if no, the method recursively calls itself to get a new file name. If the file does not exist, the file is created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error opening file

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The writeToFile method loops through the ArrayList of Employee objects and writes their attributes to the file formatted as a table
        Parameters:
        employees - ArrayList of Employee objects
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error writing to file

      • readFile

        public static void readFile()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The readFile method prompts the user to verify the data written to the file, if yes, the data is read as input and displayed to the screen
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If error reading file

      • setName

        private void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets employee name
        Parameters:
        name - Employee's name

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets employee name
        Returns:
        Employee's name

        Parameters:
